Student%20Life.Review: There are lots of type-A, partying, attractive, preppy, wealthy, econ major types but there are also tons of guys who don't fit that stereotype at all
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Definitely some problems but overall a positive thing on campus. It is huge with almost 80% of each class joining but unaffiliated students are mostly treated the same and are still welcome at all parties. Its very different than at most schools since so many people are involved. Many of the sterotypes at other schools aren't true at all here. Most people never imagined joining Greek life until coming to Dartmouth and seeing what it is really like. The houses vary a lot so there is one for almost everyone and it can be a big or small a part of your life as you want.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Sometimes a little too strict in dorms and too lenient in frats but overall not bad. They generally are just trying to make sure everyone is safe.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Somewhat popular but not a huge part of campus. Homecoming and several other key games are well attended but normal games not so much. Rugby and hockey are popular. Great gym for non-athletes and intramurals are fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Guys an girls are both very attractive, athletic, smart, outgoing, and friendly!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Lot of different people from different backgrounds, with different beliefs and experiences. Do a great job of sharing with each other and they learn a lot from interacting.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Parties are open to anyone - no exclusivity and very open and accepting!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Amazing facilities for both varsity and non varsity athletes. Incredibly active and healthy student body!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Great administration, work hard and care about the students!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Overall a good looking student body, but I am sure other schools put us to shame.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
To be honest, people don't attend many varsity games. There are two main exceptions - Princeton hockey, and Homecoming football.

The athletic facilities, on the other hand, are top-notch. Amazing fitness center, squash courts, and other facilities (the pool is being renovated this year as well).
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Despite an Ivy League status, Dartmouth students are typically rather humble rather than self-absorbed and stuck-up. There are, however, still certain exceptions.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The Greek system is quite inclusive, however, has also been charged as a catalyst for high-risk drinking and sexual assault. Greek life is a contentious issue on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The campus does not seem to be very strict. Some complain about Safety & Security officers, but most prefer dealing with them rather than with the Hanover Police.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are roughly 10% international students, in addition to a wide variety of students from within the United States. The freshman room draw provides a great opportunity to experience something other than what you are used to. My roommate's family comes from Nigeria and as such he was very different then me. I was able to learn so much about the manners in which our upbringings were starkly different and yet in other areas quite similar, an experience I really value.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I still do think Dartmouth has a way to go. There are many students who still don't feel very accepted at Dartmouth, where for race, religion or sexuality. There is a very homogenous 'typical' experience which can be very excluding for the students who don't fit that mould.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: We have a real problem with people turning up to games; some sports more than others. For example, women's basketball games never get the turn out they deserve, whereas hockey games are usually pretty well attended.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It is great if that is what you want to do. It's not my thing...
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Love the look of the guys here. All are smart and athletic, not to mention, tall!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Being an isolated New England school, diversity is okay.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I feel like there is always (in college in general) too much emphasis on sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Rule #1: Don't get caught. If you do get caught, then just be respectful, and you'll generally be fine. They understand that it is college and kids will do stupid stuff, so they try not to punish you unfairly for it. Safety and Security is generally helpful. The strictness depends on which dorms you live in; some are very lenient and some are very strict. You can tailor your life to what you want it to be.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I think that overall, we have great diversity. We have so many minorities and internationals that it is impossible not to have many of them in your friend group. Most people are accepting of everyone, but like anywhere, there are a few people that are very conservative and not the friendliest. They at least don't show it openly very often, however. LGBT groups and minority groups have lots of resources and activities and events and are very vocal on campus when things do go awry. I think it's all really good though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Some of our varsity teams are the best in the nation. It's a D1 Ivy, so sports are obviously competitive and a big part of campus life, but certainly not the most important. People cheer on the teams. Club teams and intramurals are also available, and there are many gym classes (ie. yoga, zumba, etc) as well as outdoors type classes (rock climbing, hiking, kayaking, etc.) that can all be taken for PE credit. Some club teams are more competitive than others, but our campus is really really fit and healthy overall. I'd say less than 1% of the students are obese/ overweight. The gym is big and more than enough for the average student.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Gone are the days of Dartmouth being conservative and white.  People here are also the most well adjusted of any ivy for sure.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: S&S is there to help you.  Officers are lenient. The honor code is strictly enforced which reduces cheating.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Despite what you hear in the news greek life is a friendly, healthy environment.  Everyone is welcome at every party (no guest lists like at my friends' schools) and pong is the most fun drinking game on earth.  Many of my friends are unaffiliated and still enjoy the Greek scene on their own terms.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The way they have you review this is strange but IMs are a ton of fun and tons of people participate in them (freshman floors, fraternities/sororities, groups of friends, secret societies all have teams) and the gym is great.  Sporting events are under-attended, but that goes with the ivy league territory...  At the end of the day, the athletes are still D1 so those games which you do attend will be high quality.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Football team sucked; moreso the attitudes of some varsity athletes suck.  They act as if they have more of a right to social spaces...but due to the nature of the frat scene--they are the social space.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Alot of drinking, sexual assault, rape, overall disrespect towards women; peer pressure; lack of leadership regarding violence/rape culture against women
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: The officers (Safety and Security) are actually there for your security, not to get you in to trouble.  Dartmouth is fairly lenient with its policies making the campus life quite enjoyable.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There have recently been many protests over this exact same concept of diversity.  I think Dartmouth may be able to do a better job with the diversity here, but it is hard to please everybody.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: As for Varsity sports, we kind of suck.  Nobody really cares though, since almost everyone here is an athlete in one way or another.  Most people go to the gym and even for a small school, our gym is way too small.  And we need more basketball courts for the normal students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Attitudes of privilege can be prevalent depending on your social circles. Dartmouth is pretty diverse on the whole, though
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life runs the social atmosphere on campus. Everyone is allowed to go to most parties, mostly because those are the only parties. They are somewhat insular and revolve around drinking, but it is usually the only option.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review:
The college is strict on varying topics and situations. School safety officers will sometimes be harsh on frat parties and other times won't seem to care or stop anything from going wrong. The administration is aware of the drinking, drug, race, and sexual assault problems, but will only really address it now that it is being publicized in the media.

It lacks consistency in it strictness. I have also seen occurrences where black students have received punishment (including suspension/expulsion) for the same situations (involving drinking, drugs, academic or sexual assault problems) as their white counterparts, but the white students have not received the same punishment.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review:
guys are athletic and "fratty"
girls are new england preppy
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review:
many options
majority of students are affiliated
greek houses are more like clubs/extra things students do rather than exclusive cliques
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review:
students are very active and athletic
many are varsity or club athletes
part of D1 athletics by virtue of ivy-league, but dont expect a huge football school
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review:
Campus officers are kind and helpful
Small school lends itself to strong and cooperative community
Students are given a high degree of independence
Very strict honor code
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Watch Animal House. Understand the importance of frats to Dartmouth. Know that we are actually nothing like Animal House. Yes, we have some crazy frats, but we also have very respectable frats for every type of person. It is both totally ok not to pledge, and totally ok to do so as well. No pressure, as you cannot rush until Sophomore year. On another note, many of our Frats broke from National organisations in the 1950s when these organisations instituted racist policies. Go Dartmouth!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Alcohol is and always will be an issue, but the big debate is protesting. there are a small number of vary radical students who protest everything. The administration lets them, but this may change due to student complaints.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I do the forestry team and fencing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's Dartmouth. We invented social.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I have friends from all over the world and from various religious and ethnic backgrounds. Dartmouth frats famously broke from national ones when national frats banned certain minorities back in the 50s. Anyone who says dartmouth is intolerant is just looking for problems that are not there.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I think the girls on campus are all very pretty, and they are certainly all very smart and usually able to carry out very interesting conversations.  All girls are pretty athletic, and there seems to be a range in attire from preppy to really athletic.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: You can go to almost any game you want and have no trouble finding seats.  There isn't much of a following for most sports, but students do enjoy going to most varsity athletic events and take pride in it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Parties are open to all the students, but there is such great involvement in frats and sororities that you'd feel left out if you were unaffiliated.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: With the exception of a handful of international students, Dartmouth is a pretty homogenous community. The students are predominately white as are the professors. The greek system is dominated by heterosexual white men who come from wealthy families and who are not very accepting, particularly of students with different sexual orientation. Because Dartmouth is far from any major city, it lacks the level of diversity (racial & economic) that many colleges in urban communities have.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: not the best looking, but people are very friendly and love the school. Really great friends and people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is very big at Dartmouth for almost all students; it really dominates the social scene, especially for underclassmen who cannot drink anywhere else.  There isn't a big party scene outside of the Greek houses, but you don't have to be a member or even know a member to attend.  Rush happens sophomore year (meaning you get to explore Greek life and meet affiliated and unaffiliated students before choosing whether it's for you), and while most students do rush one of the 17 fraternities, 10 sororities, or three co-ed houses, it's not a big deal if you decide not to rush.  And for people who don't like the idea of frat parties, the college does a great job with alternative programming and smaller parties.  Whether affiliated or unaffiliated, a supporter of the Greek scene or a condemner of it, you can find people to hang out with and you won't be judged for your choice.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity sports at Dartmouth College are really cool, especially when it is a game against another college within the Ivy League, which I feel makes it all the more exciting. I'd have to say academics takes hold here, but there are quite a number of games that get a great turnout for the game. Our gym is amazing. We have everything any athlete would need. Our football field is next to the gym and on campus, which makes it really easy to walk to considering Dartmouth is a small college. I'd have to say that one of the more popular sports at Dartmouth is Hockey.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Athletes are pretty respected, but I don't think games have that good of attendance, with the exception of select hockey and football games. Facilities are pretty nice, and athletes definitely have perks though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I feel like whatever background you may come from you'll be able to find someone like you and/or a community to identify with, if you so choose. That's not to say that some groups are definitely more represented/visible than others. Regardless, Greek houses (the main component of social life) have plenty of minority members (sexual orientation, ethnic, otherwise), much more than you would see at a typical state school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: UGA's (RA's) are generally pretty lenient, Safety and Security mainly just tries to keep you safe. You might get in trouble if you do something that ends up crossing the desk of an administrator or judicial, then they tend to be less understanding--but you generally have to do something pretty bad for that to happen.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: While the College is actively trying to diversify the student body, especially with the large amount of Native American students admitted this past year, there is still a need from more diversity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: As a member of the Greek scene at Dartmouth I am a bit indifferent. I have had such  a great time meeting new people and engaging in conversations with people very different from me that would only occur within the Greek scene. The down side is that it dominates campus social life and if you don't drink and are not into the hook up culture it could be hard to navigate. I personally dont drink but have been able to find my place within greek life on campus and am so glad I joined.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek like dominates. You have to go Greek (and enter one of the three "good" sororities or 5 "good" fraternities) to be considered social/cool.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Dartmouth students don't really seem to care about sports teams. No one really goes to sporting events other than hockey games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: With Dartmouth being fairly isolated, Greek life dominates the social scene.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is really big at Dartmouth, both fraternities and sororities, and most people who are eligible (sophomores and older) to be in a house do join one.  While most of the nightlife involves the fraternities– which are generally open to all students indiscriminately– there are other options of things to do, and there isn't a whole lot of social status or stigma associated with particular houses.  Every house has at least some really cool people, and going to parties or going to play pong can be  a lot of fun.  The greek system is there if you want it, but not totally necessary; I have friends that spend multiple nights a week going out to frats and some that have never set foot in one, and all of them are great people and are enjoying themselves.  It is what you make of it!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Dartmouth does a good job in creating a inclusive environment.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Out of all the Ives, dartmouth is definitely one of the top for athletic programs. Almost everyone is involved in some sort of sport, whether it is varsity athletics, club, or intramural. There is never a dull moment on campus, if you are looking for an activity, there are always people who are willing to go on an adventure with you. Hockey is our sport but football is working their way back to being a big part of the student culture. There are always crowds at the lacrosse games especially the women's games since they are one of the top programs in the country. Men's soccer and rugby are also huge at dartmouth and everyone always makes going to the games a huge part of the day.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: it's an issue at dartmouth but people are also working hard to make a change. I wouldn't say everyone is white because there are a lot of minorities there. If you are looking to go to a  school who is consistently working hard on their issues, dartmouth is for you. They are always open to new ideas and students looking to be active leaders for change.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: The campus is not very strict at all. The police are basically there to make sure you don't die. Every once in a while they will get someone in trouble to make an example, but for the most part they are actually very nice. Some topics like hazing are treated more harshly though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I think Dartmouth has a pretty good variety of guys and girls.  There are a lot of affluent, slightly preppy guys who wear polos and boat shoes, but there are also hipsters, athletic guys, nerdy guys, etc.  Girls are usually genuine and there aren't too many biddies.  There are a lot of attractive people, as well as plenty of unattractive people, but true to stereotype, most of the less-atrractive, geekier types don't go out and only socialize amongst themselves, so you don't see them around so much.  Quite a bit of diversity for a school its size.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Even though a large percent of Dartmouth students are athletes, there is not a lot of school spirit when it comes to sports. There is an absurd amount of school spirit in general because everyone loves Dartmouth but our sports teams do not have many fans at their games. Soccer, hockey, rugby, and baseball usually do well and tend to have more fans and support than the other sports. Fortunately for our athletes, they get treated like royalty regardless of their records. They have really nice training facilities, free academic tutors, free gear, and free chocolate milk in the weight room! IM sports are where it is at in the athletic scene though. Especially when the greek system gets involved.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity sports at Dartmouth are fairly important, and Dartmouth is home to many athletes and athletic students. Our gym is pretty nice, and is almost constantly getting an upgrade of some sort. That being said, Varsity can be a bit competitive and it can be hard to walk on a team, but that's why our IM and  club sports are there! Those are just as competitive as their varsity counterparts, but can be more fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Totally Chill – The only student I know who's ever been put on academic probation was a kid who was arrested for ordering drugs from overseas.  Although the local police puts up a big show, campus safety and security really just cares about the well-being of the students.  Underage drinking is common, and there is a system in place to protect students in danger due to drinking without facing any charges.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review:
Greek life is pretty all-encompassing at Dartmouth.  While other communities do exist - notably the Dartmouth Outing Club, Theater, and Religious Groups, among others - 60% of eligible students (sophomores to seniors) are affiliated.  Although involvement after pledge term varies greatly.

Also, there's no bad blood if you're not affiliated.  Many people choose not to go Greek.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review:
The guys are typically very nice and intelligent. There are all kinds of different types, but you do have to watch out for the guys who only want a hook-up.

The girls are okay. Most are small and pretty, but some can be very emotional and a little too controlling. If you  look, you can find a good one though. But most of the good ones tend to be taken.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review:
A Fit Student Body – over 75% of the student body is involved in varsity sports and a majority of the ones not involved in varsity sports are involved in a club sport, dance group, or other active group.  

It is a very activity based campus.  There are clubs/groups for every interest.  Fraternities and sororities are also big.

There is a variety of types of people--there are the jocks, artsy, preps, etc, like all schools.  The dress is mainly preppy, although you will see athletes and hard core studiers in sweats the majority of the time.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review:
Freedom to Breathe – Dartmouth is generally not as strict as some schools. The dorms do not have monitors, so there is no strict visitor policy (unlike at some schools that I have visited friends at). Academically, we follow the Honor Principal, and though the cost of being discovered cheating can be severe (suspension for the term, etc.), there isn't a lot of regulation in the sense that students aren't expected to cheat. 
Likewise, for drinking, the policy tends to gear towards student safety. There is a student-initiated Good Sam policy in that if a student is intoxicated, a "Good Sam" (for "Good Samaritan") may be called in, and the student will be checked out and given care as necessary. Even if the student is underage, the student will not receive an infraction unless he/she resists the officer.
In essence, if extreme infractions are committed, there are certainly consequences, but the campus police are NOT trying to breathe down the students backs. In general administration is trying to work with students and protect them, not police them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: We have a very statistically diverse school - it always ranks highest among the most diverse student bodies. However, like many other aspects of life, students tend to group themselves with like-students. Therefore, I've found that the Greek system, the dominating social scene on campus, is very "white-washed," and that other minority-organizations tend to stick to themselves. That being said, we have many minority-based events that are very vocal, and I've never seen or experienced any racist behavior that made me feel unconfortable.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Getting Better – Overall, Men's soccer is the only sport on campus that consistently is a top 25 D1 NCAA team.  They have made the NCAA tourney for the past 5 consecutive years and have had 3 players go professional.  Other than that hockey is decent at best.  Over the past few years, athletics have been getting better with each new class garnering more talent, especially the 2015 class.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Depends on the S&S Officer – Most of the time, S&S (the campus/public safety) officers are very understanding and often look the other way, as long as you are not in danger. If they bust a party in your dorm room, they might write you up, or they might just tell you to pour your drinks out. It depends on who you get... I was pretty unlucky one time and had the only strict officer on campus bust my party. But otherwise, most students feel that S&S really is there to help them. As far as academics go, the honor code is very important to Dartmouth so you don't want to be on the other end of that judicial violation.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: All Inclusive Animal House – The Animal House vision most people have of Dartmouth is alive and well in frats like AD (the real life version of John Belushi's frat), Theta Delt (also known as TDX), and Psi U. That being said, there are a variety of options which a less rage-y prospective greek member can aim for. From stoners (who tend to rush Bones Gate) to the outdoorsy (Alpha Chi) and even to the math majors (Sig Nu), there is a home for every type of person in the Dartmouth greek system. Each house has its own unique stereotype as well as a large selection of brothers who fit horribly into that mould.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Super Diverse – My writing class consisted of two native americans, three hispanic kids, three african americans, four asians, and 5 white students. pretty much reflective of the entire school. A lot fo white preppy kids though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Very Diverse, but Some Say Not Enough – The campus is extremely diverse, especially for its small size, but that hasn't helped the race relations much.  Partly do to that small size and diversity groups often feel marginalized and act out in disturbing ways.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: If you're not going to rush a frat, you might want to consider another school. The frat culture is pervasive and nearly 60-70% of eligible students rush. There is nearly nothing to do other than frat parties at night, save hanging out with friends in the dorm.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Dating is Possible – I don't know why everyone says it is impossible to have a relationship here. Six people on my floor (myself included) are in serious relationships with other people here at Dartmouth. I see couples holding hands on campus all the time. The D-Plan makes sustaining these relationships more difficult, but it is definitely possible. Hookups are prevalent, but they are not the only option!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Anyone can go to any of the frats and hang out, play a game of pong, or dance. It's so different from the exclusive Greek life at southern state schools. I love it!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Safety and Security is pretty chill about drinking, and there are usually no legal consequences.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: High Enrollment of Native Americans – Dartmouth College has a very diverse community, including a great diversity within the Native American community. The Native American Program is awesome and helps aid Native students throughout the year.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Good for both – Most people are athletic and attractive here. However it is an ivy, and looks will be at or below your average State school. My sister attended Yale, so I went there a lot in high school, and the guys here are slightly more attractive, and the girls slightly less. Dartmouth is the second most attractive Ivy under Yale, and therefore give guys an A and girls an A-/A.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone Is Awesome – Everyone has their own interest. No matter who you are and what you do, you can find similarly minded people and have a great time.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Campus Security Good, Hanover Police Awful – Campus security (Safety and Security, aka S&S) is pretty good, they usually aren't too strict.  If you are clearly drunk and might need some help, they send you to dicks house or they will respond to a call (a "Good Sam") asking for their help.  Neither gets you in legitimate trouble.  They do put fraternities on probation, however, fairly frequently.
Hanover police, however, are a completely different story.  They seem to do anything they can to get dartmouth kids in trouble (probably because they don't have anything else to do).  They will literally drive around looking for any drunk person they can find.  I know many, many kids who have been arrested for drinking.  They also conduct drug stings.  Everyone hates hpo and the chief is constantly mocked by students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Very Prevalent – Definitely a big part of campus, but it's possible to get away.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Very Athletic Campus – We have great facilities.  I'm not a huge athlete, so I've been on a club team, which is not a large time commitment.  Our winter sports are especially great.  We have an amazing hockey team which the whole campus follows.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It Depends – At Dartmouth your punishment really depends on what you've done academically or socially. Academically, it's not that bad: just don't fail. However if you get Good Sammed too many times, watch out! You might get Park'd.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone Is Pretty Average – We're an attractive group of people at Dartmouth but we really don't stand out. The minorities are pretty hot though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I have met so many people from different walks of life. Everyone on campus is very open minded to people who may not be the same as them. In this way, no one is afraid of expressing him or herself.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Love and Lust – It is true. Dartmouth is very much a hook-up school. This is because a.) everyone comes here knowing about the hook-up culture and models their relationships according (self-fulfilling prophecy); b.) in high school, we put a lot of things on the backburner, so hooking up is a way to sample the many things we missed out on; and c.) we have hormones and school feels too demanding to develop a relationship. However, all hope is not lost as there are plenty of couples whose relationships range from casual and low-pressure to "married for life." In terms of looks, I would give Dartmouth a B+ because when someone looks good, they look GOOD. Everyone is athletic and in shape for the most part. One more thing, the guys are slightly better looking than the girls. I would give the guys a B+, maybe an A-, and the girls a solid B. However, the girls can go out of their way and really glam it up.
Student%20Life.Author: Niche User

Student%20Life.Review: Greeks Totally Dominate the Scene – Dartmouth is a very Greek centric community. If you aren't in to that kind of thing you will be fine though. There are plenty of students who don't join a house - but over 60% do end up joining.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Guys and Girls Are Pretty Good Looking – I mean, it's an ivy league school so you don't have tons of models here but the majority of the student population is pretty good looking.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Nowwww It's Good. When I was a freshmen, I think all our sports teams collectively won maybe 1 game.  Two years later, that's managed to turn around.  Our formerly winless football team held their own through overtime, losing by a touchdown to Ivy League favorites, UPenn, which also happens to have almost 3x the undergraduates.  Participation is good, everyone does at least some kind of physical activity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Very Diverse-Especially for New Hampshire – While white is the majority, all races are prevalent on campus. As with most colleges, self-segregation is an issue but all groups are equally as accepting of other races and cultural backgrounds. The LGBT community is out in the open and accepted by everyone. As far as socio-economic status, there are a lot of rich, private school kids.  There's no discrimination against those on financial aid but at times the way of thinking of rich kids compared to middle class kids can be weird. But I think people of any culture or class would overall be comfortable at Dartmouth.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Pretty Lax – The college can be asinie if you get caught, but the chances are very low especially since s n s rarely enters a frat house and won't check your ID unless you're genuinely acting like an idiot. Many freshmen get away with a lot of thing they wouldnt otherwise have been able to. The campus is strict however on plagiarism. You can get kicked out for plagiarizing yourself!
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Sports Are Unheard of – I don't hear very much good about our spotrs teams and the only time anyone ever goes to a game is if they know someone on the team. That being said IM sports are pretty well attended and are a lot of fun
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Long-lasting relationships are possible, but hard to come by. Most relationships are limited to drunken hook-ups that begin in frat basements. Many students blame the D-Plan for this lack of commitment.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: They say its a very diverse campus, and during the day it seems like it as well, but social scene is very white.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Party Scene Revolves Around the Frats – I'm a person who does like the Greek party scene, so I would give it an A. I wouldn't say the social scene revolves around the Greek life because there are a ton of other social outlets. However, partying and drinking go hand in hand with the frats. Half the campus is affiliated, what can I say? They're also VERY open and no exclusivity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Somewhat Overrated – Dartmouth has pretty much average frat parties. They're open to everyone, generally speaking, which can be nice for those who like to fill their weekends with Dartmouth's freely-flowing Keystone Light. I say average because they are neither super-rowdy nor super-downbeat. There are Greek houses pretty much for everyone.

I claim Greek life is overrated because there are those who within the system for whom nothing else seems to matter. Greek life is their life. However, for those outside or on the periphery of the system, which is a solid if not an overwhelming majority, the fuss about which house is better than what house can seem downright, well, fussy and pointless. The majority of campus falls somewhere in between. It's up to you how involved you want to get with Greek life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Good Sports – Sports at Dartmouth are prevalent on campus. While we do not excel at all our sports, we have a strong fan base.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are so many different types of people at Dartmouth. The campus is full of different cultures and backgrounds ranging from Native Americans to Australians. The diversity on campus is a great way to expand knowledge and understanding of others.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not Very Strict – Things are pretty lenient. The police patrol campus but underage drinking still clearly goes on and they know that we do it. It's just the culture of the campus and what not.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Footbal Team – we have a very very bad football team. We are lucky if we win 2 games a season.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Frats and Sororities Dominate the Scene – Out of all eligible students (sophomores and upperclassmen), 60% are Greek. However, the Greek system at Dartmouth is very open, and freshmen and non-Greeks are extremely welcome at all social functions. The houses are very involved with on-campus activities, often co-sponsoring concerts and charity events.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Boy and Girls at Darthmouth – the students are very friendly and interesting they are very wise and smart.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: One of the main attractions of my school, is that its off secluded in the mountains, in fact we call it the "Dartmouth Bubble" its great, but its also terrible. Terrible in the sense that we are sheltered perhaps from the real world with all of the tolerance of different walks of life on campus, that perhaps it enables us to be prepared for the real world, where people are ignorant some times of sexuality or stereotypical images. Sometimes coming home from breaks I forget that in every day life people will stare at a group of people that randomly decided to dress in costumes and go to class,while spray painting their hair bright orange. I also forget that sometimes telling someone that you are not straight could be something to deal with in the real world, but for now I revel in the fact that diversity is celebrated at my school,in the most positive of ways.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's pretty diverse. On a scale from 0 to 10, I would put Dartmouth's diversity at a 7 or 8ish. Anything higher would, by necessity, mean compromising the emphasis on merit that exists within the system to the extent that is unfair. A school that is a to-scale proportion of every demographic group within the United States is either a miraculously precise coincidence or a lie. Basically, the demographic situation at Dartmouth is ideal.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Great, some professors could be more involved.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Huge variety of topics; there are too many classes I want to take, and there isn't enough time. Registration is easy; if you want a class, you're pretty much going to get it.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The work load can be overwhelming with the other athletics and activities expected of students. Time is just tight.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The campus offers so MANY avenues to improve readings e.g. RWIT tutoring
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: At any time, students may sign up for a minimum of two classes and a maximum of four classes a term. Usually, one would take three. Now, three classes doesn't sound like a lot of work, but Dartmouth runs on a trimester system so each term flashes by in about 10 weeks. Also, it's Dartmouth, you're in for a lot of work no matter what class you sign up for! I think I was pretty lucky my first term though. I signed up for classes in Spanish, Human Biology, and Multivariable Calculus, but it felt like I had much less work and stress than expected for my first term of college. That's not to say the classes were super easy, but I definitely got more sleep than most of my friends did haha. Also, I did super well in all of my classes and my exams! I think that was mostly in part due to my professors. They were friendly and actually cared about what they were teaching and the success of their students. The curriculum of their classes were also well-organized, although I did feel a little rushed due to there being only 10 weeks to learn everything. Even so, I can definitely say I'm looking forward to the classes I'll be taking in the future. Dartmouth has such a wide variety of subjects, being a liberal arts school, that I can always find something to be interested in if I'm unable to get into the class I wanted.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The professors I've had have been great and very approachable.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I had a full-time internship this summer at a hospital research center than was unpaid but Dartmouth gave me a stipend to cover living expenses and food and I still had a couple thousand left over to save. I felt very prepared for the internship because of my classes at Dartmouth. I was able to do an independent project and write a paper to publish in a scientific journal.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Fantastic opportunities and professors are always available to help you.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Great facilities, decent workload, fantastic professors and research opportunities. Lots of internship and job opportunities - students are highly sought after by employers!
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Top-notch school with fantastic academics! Students are smart and driven. Great professors, programs, and lots of opportunities for research. Strong focus on undergrads!
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Great study-abroad program in New Zealand for Anthropology majors. Amazing faculty and programs in all departments. Tons of internship and job opportunities - students are highly sought after by employers!
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Fantastic internship opportunities - students are highly sought after by companies. Great academic programs with lots of choices and great programs and professors! Very focused on undergraduates with lots of opportunities to do research!
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I couldn't be more impressed. The US News #1 undergrad teaching ranking seems accurate. The profs I have had have been incredibly smart, articulate, and passionate, and are often leaders in their fields. The library is great - very modern and plenty of space to study (except for during finals). The workload is tough but manageable; it definitely forces you to be careful with your time management.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I do not think it is difficult to be accepted into the department you would like to major in.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I am currently undeclared so I have not negative nor positive to say.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The professors seem to really have an interest in students as individuals. I have profited from relatively small class sizes couple with very accommodating office hours.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Considering the fact that I am currently undecided, this may defeat some of the purpose of the question. Nevertheless, it can be difficult to still be uncertain about what to major in when you feel you ought to decide quickly so that you can start moving toward being successful in the respective department; however, the stress is more from an internal cause than an external one.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Economics is one of the most popular majors are Dartmouth, its very good for job opportunities but also very competitive in that aspect. Workload depends on the class really, but generally its pretty rigorous.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The Economics Department is one of the biggest at Dartmouth, so that's very helpful. It can mean that the program can be very impersonal though.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I've taken some really great classes here are Dartmouth. There is definitely a wide variety of in depth scholarship. There are also however classes that are poorly taught, uninteresting etc. I wish the academic advising here was better; once you get to sophomore year you find that it would have been helpful to have somewhat of a more strategic approach during freshman year
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Super easy. All majors open to everyone.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Former White House Internship-Office of Legislative Affairs
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Government major is a very strong department, committed professors, and interesting/challenging classes
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: We do not pick majors until the end of our sophomore year, but we do have academic advisers that guide us throughout our time here at Dartmouth in our respective fields.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The application process was not difficult, nor was the interview process, but it was nerve-wracking because of the reputation of the college. I believe the most important criteria for admission was being a well-rounded student, who was not only academically successful, but also had interests, hobbies, and focused on serving the community.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review:
no problem "getting into a program"
students declare major their 2nd year based on their interest
no need to apply to a major except for a BE at Thayer Engineering School
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: career services is heavily biased towards offerings for finance and management consulting
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review:
Lots of attention from professors
Small classes and supportive learning environment
My major is gaining more popularity (Comp Sci) and we dont have enough professors or a variety of new topics that students are interested in (data mining, deep learning, cloud computing, mobile programming) which has affected my major
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review:
lots of study options on campus
supportive deans
professors are widely available, helpful, and genuinely interested in students
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: It's pretty much the same as it would probably be at other schools.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I am a Government major and the faculty has been very supportive, not just academically, but also in terms of off campus opportunities. Government is one of the most popular majors at Dartmouth. The  professors are experts in their field. For being such a small school, I am very pleased with the variety of classes they offer each term. Even the intro classes, which tend to be very dull have been engaging and worthwhile.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: The quarter system makes for a rigorous academic term. With only 10 weeks of class per term, there is little room for mistakes or for missing class. However, the professors are eager to work with undergrads, and they go above and beyond to help students outside of class time. The benefit of the quarter system is that it makes it easy to study abroad. More than half the students at Dartmouth study abroad; and it is not unheard of that some students study abroad twice in there four years at Dartmouth.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I'm in Engineering at Dartmouth, and while it's a very intense program to do in four years, I have really enjoyed it so far.  The major is very flexible, and you don't have to go into it with a discipline in mind-- there are no departments within the engineering school, so you can take classes all across the board and really explore your options.  The professors I've had have been very helpful, both in lecture, outside-of-class help, and in helping students find engineering related jobs on campus and for off terms.  The engineering program involves a lot of hands-on, design-based courses, even for beginning students, and quite a few patents have come out of one of Dartmouth's introductory engineering classes, which I find really cool!
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: There are great majors at Dartmouth.  If you can't decide then you can major and minor; major and major; major and modify (similar to major and major but not as legit.)
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The Professors you'll have at Dartmouth themselves are worth applying to Dartmouth.  Overall the academics are amazing.  Any topic you're interested in--they'll have a class relating to it.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Dartmouth offers a range of classes on almost anything you're interested in.  I'm a History major but was able to modify it with Asian Literature which goes to show the flexibility of the system.  The profs are probably the best in the US.  I've taken every single one of them out to lunch, and have continued to correspond with them since taking their classes.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: There is not a process for getting into programs at Dartmouth. You simply have to fill out a major card and get it signed. Depending on the major it may take longer because you have to figure out all of your classes from the get in go. The D-plan makes this more difficult because classes are not always offered and you have ot figure out how to get it all in. Other than that, the process is exceptionally easy in comparison to other places.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I am very happy with my program. All of the professors I work with truly care about us and our goals. They help us to not only push ourselves but to be there when we are confused. I feel as if they have done a really good job at helping my goals seem attainable. I plan to teach in the Middle East after graduation and to later work with women's education initiatives in Afghanistan. Though these ideas are a little robust, I have gotten nothing but support and green lights from my program and their confidence gives me confidence.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Generally i really enjoy all of the departments I am in. The professors are great and work really hard to accommodate our needs. I have found that most professors are willing to sit in their office with you and discuss life and options for life after Dartmouth on any given day. This is quite special. I also think that there is quite a network of alumni to utilize that the department works hard to make accessible to us as students.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I absolutely love how at Dartmouth you can pursue any academic field you want, in fact you can pursue several at a time! I am majoring in Government which allows me to take courses that focus on comparative politics, international relations, and political theory. I am also minoring in Arabic Language and Literature as well as Human Development and Education. The problem with my areas of study are that it is hard to find internships that pay. I have worked for non profits and had wonderful experiences but was essentially volunteering.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: As a freshman we do not declare until our fifth term. You have some time to decide what you want to study. However, I have become familiar with the Women and Gender studies program. The professors are amazing and the classes are more than interesting. I am going to continue to take courses in this department. Career wise I plan to become involved in social activism maybe through law. My focus would be on the LGBT community. This field is not very accessible and many look at a degree in Women and Gender Studies as nothing, but I hope to change people's outlook on that.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I am in neuroscience, and it is okay, some of the profs are good, other are bad. The classes are challenging, but after so many you get the hang of it.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: You're at an Ivy League institution. The smallest Ivy, in fact. Personal attention coupled with distinguished, accomplished professors= recipe for academic success.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review:
Professors are experts in their field, and most are very accessible. If you go to office hours or set up appointments, they are more than willing to help you. They genuinely want you to do well.
Most classes aren't that large, and even in large classes, it is easy to get to know the professor if you put in the effort. My lecture class last term was only about 60 students, and my lecture class next term will be around 50. My freshmen writing course last term was 16 students, and my freshmen seminar next term will only be 11 students.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Professors are experts in their field and most are very accessible. They genuinely want you to do well, so if you go to their office hours or set up appointments, they will be more than eager to help.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review:
Dartmouth is number one in the country for undergraduate teaching.  Professors are passionate about not only their work, but also their students.  Outside the classroom, there is a take-your-professor to lunch program.

The workload and curriculum are challenging, but not as difficult as I expected.  Definitely manageable.  Registration is online and very easy.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review:
I am a Theater major.  First of all, there are only 6 majors in my department in my year.  While this does lead to a lot of attention for each of us, the department isn't as organized as it could be.

One big plus of my major program is that our department pays for us to travel to see plays and musicals.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I'm a Socy major and the courses are definitely interesting. Some really explore to the sociological aspects, while others end up being more about the topic and don't really address how it fits into the whole sociological picture. I enjoy the topic very much, but I can't really say that there's anything particularly special about the department here.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: The Anthropology department is amazing--all the professors are really accessible and know what they're talking about. Classes are interesting, moderate intensity, and you learn a ton. Can't recommend any more.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Tough and Rigorous – You Might think that taking three courses would be a breeze.  Think again
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Academics at Dartmouth are great! There is a class on anything you can imagine and the professors are always available and willing to talk to you during office hours. Professors are also always willing to offer lab work or internships.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Lots of Homework – Thee is a lot of work but  there is suppot  - free tutoring for athletes or  for anyone on financial aid
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The World at Your Fingertips – I plan to declare my major in Biology, with a concentration in Ecology. I have struggled through the typical science major 'weeder' classes such as the introductory Bio 11 and the intro chemistry sequence, but it all gets better from here. With higher-division courses come fascinating subject material such as Vertebrate Zoology, professors who know your name and invite you to assist them with their research, interesting labs, and classmates passionate about the same things you are. Whether you are on a pre-med track or simply have an interest in Ecology, Organismal Biology, or Genetics, Dartmouth's Biological Sciences department has a wide range of academic and research opportunities such as the Foreign Study Program in Costa Rica.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: A Mixed Bag – Some professors can be fairly helpful, but some professors are not very good at teaching.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Sociology/Romance Studies Double Major – Our language program is world-renowned, and it deserves the credit.  I've yet to be disappointed by either a language class (Spanish and French) or a Sociology class.  Our professors are distinguished in their fields, passionate and available for outside conversations at all times.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Undergraduate Teaching – Dartmouth focuses strongly on undergraduate teaching. I always had a professor for all of my courses, and most of the classes were small. Extra help was always available.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Good Resources, Okay Classes. Professors are experts in their field and there are lots of resources. The quality of the classes, however, aren't very consistent across the board: some are great, others are mediocre. As one of the few undergrad institutions with access to fMRI machines, Dartmouth has potential to provide a great education in the Psychological and Brain Sciences.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Love It. The D-plan is great.  Students really get the best internships.  The professors are all really friendly and know me personally by name.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Great Professors, Smaller Classes – Since Dartmouth College has a pretty small student population, classes are pretty small.  Even lecture classes are smaller than most at other schools.  This allows for more student/professor interaction, so you're really involved in making the most of your own education. The workload is pretty heavy, but shouldn't be unmanageable if you learn good time management skills.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Difficult but Plenty of Opportunities and Support – Dartmouth has a pretty rigorous biology/pre-med curriculum. There are many potential pre-meds, so there is a lot of competition. The introductory classes are quite difficult and time-consuming. However, most of the professors are very effective and helpful. The labs, facilities, and courses give you a solid foundation in the subject material. There are also tons of opportunities for students to get involved with research on and off-campus. There is also a lot of flexibility in designing your major and picking what classes you want to take.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Challenging, but Fun – Classes are taught by Profs.  Teaching aids help the Prof, but will rarely teach class.  Teaching aides are much more likely to lead lab and be there for study help.  It's a little annoying that Profs still take attendance, as we're not in high school anymore, but you should go to class anyway.  Especially class discussions: these are the best.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: I love the small town college feel with Hanover residents part of the college scene.  I love the way 70 years olds, golden retrievers, and young families with baby strollers all are seen walking the streets of Hanover wearing Dartmouth gear. Love, love love it here!
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Nothing much I can report: it's pretty decent out here in the wild
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Hanover, New Hampshire is certainly a charming, little cottage town. It's right by the Connecticut River so one can go swimming, canoeing, fishing, whatever when the weather's nice. Occom Pond is also nearby and open for swimming and canoeing as well and in the winter, one could probably go ice-skating there! I'll have to be honest, I'm totally in love with the scenery of New Hampshire, that's why I applied to Dartmouth because it was literally 25 minutes away from home. Among other things, there are plenty of cool museums and cultural attractions around too. There's the Hood Museum, the Hopkins Center, and the Nugget Theater right in town. Across the river in Vermont is the Montshire Museum as well less than a half hour away. Dining and shopping is also possible in Hanover with the numerous local stores and restaurants. I definitely recommend eating at Jewel of India, Bolocos, and Morano Gelato if you ever get the chance. Shopping in Hanover is pretty expensive though (some of my friends literally spent $70 on a knitted Dartmouth sweater), but unless you're really into fancy clothing and whatnot, it's probably better to head over to the shopping centers in West Lebanon. You'll probably have an easier time finding a parking space too haha. If you don't have a car though, you can always take the Advanced Transit and circle around Hanover, Lebanon, and West Lebanon. As for the locals, most of the people I've met and talked to have been pretty friendly. They didn't mind giving directions to a lost college student, although some will (understandably) be peeved if you decide to cross the street in the worst possible place.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: If you're okay being away from popular attractions, diverse options for shopping, and just being away from any major city in general, this is a wonderful place to live. Initially, I thought being away from the city was going a culture shock, but it is actually the best choice I made. I prefer being away from the bustle because it allows to better concentrate on my academics. Plus, I don't have to worry about spending any large amount on nights in town. Although certain necessities like food and hygiene items are overpriced. We have a CVS and two grocers that are both a 15-minute walk away from campus. Also, Hanover's clothing is pricy; befriend a person with a car and go to West Lebanon, the next town over. As far as the town itself, it's cozy and welcoming. And it's pretty safe enough to walk alone in the evenings.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Its in the middle of the mountains of New Hampshire and Vermont which depending on the person is either a plus or a minus. I love all of the outdoor activities like skiing, hiking, and rock climbing that we have access to and it is a beautiful place during every season. There is little to offer for nightlife (besides frats), shopping, museums, or things that you might find in a city. There are still some really cool things to do though if you have a car. Burlington, the Ben and Jerry's factory, a drive in theater, local farmers markets and fairs, swimming holes, roller skating rinks and other local activities are all popular. Montreal is only a couple hours away. Also, Dartmouth runs busses to Boston and New York several times a day so cities are still accessible.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Amazing campus facilities, very nice, clean, and well-maintained! Strong campus traditions and fun events!
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Absolutely amazing scenery! Mountains, river, open green spaces, forests, stars everywhere, and beautiful leaf colors in the fall!!
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Overall, the campus is amazing...the buildings are mostly modern inside (with the exception of a few dorms and random buildings).
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Hanover is a very welcoming community. It feels safe and the nature is beautiful.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The computer science majors have their own building with their own labs, and the engineers do too. We have a media center with unlimited access to any kind of digital tech (computers, microphones, cameras, etc) and a computer area in the library. I have never needed a computer and not been able to find one. That being said, it's absolutely necessary to bring your own for convenience's sake. Everyone has their own, and it makes life a lot easier.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: It's a quaint New England Town with many greats restaurants and shops. There are all the basic amenities that you would want, but it is certainly not a town for college students looking to go to bars and nightclubs (there are none!). That being said, the people are nice and friendly, and the surrounding area is gorgeous with many outoorsy things to do and lots of people taking advantage of it. It's near two big highways, so travel to other places is possible, and there is a free bus system that runs to the neighboring five towns that runs Mon-Fri.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: Getting to school after breaks is painless with the Dartmouth Coach.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Small bar scene for 21+.  Otherwise there's a movie theater, pub trivia, and more options in surrounding towns.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Tech support is phenomenal and there are computers all over campus if you ever need one that's not your own (though you should definitely purchase one). Wifi has gotten worse since I got here but they're apparently doing something about it.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Bad in the winter but the glorious spring/summer can't be beat and going to the farmers market on the green in fall feels perfectly "college"
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Very cold winters--often well below 0.  Just get a solid NorthFace or equivalent and boots and you'll be fine.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: If you don't have a car, or money for zipcar, you are out of luck
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: Winter sucks.  Imagine coming from sunny California and BAM! Put into blankets of snow and ice with sub zero degree temperatures.  Sometimes in the winter I don't even go to class because I get way too cold.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The tech support is fine.  My main complaint is the wireless network.  It sucks.  Sometimes it takes what seems to be days to load a single page.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The social scene is basically just drinking.  Frats run the social scene here at Dartmouth. Because freshmen do not have cars, it is very difficult to go off campus.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: small community that breeds inclusion
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Most student just walk. There's no real need for public transportation on campus because you can get from one end of the school to the other in a 10-minute walk. If you're going off campus, there is a shuttle but it's not very reliable and comes infrequently.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: The school's facilities and aesthetics are truly top-notch in my opinion. We have a great athletic center and numerous libraries on campus; a big Green space in the middle of campus that students utilize daily. It's great to sit out in the Sun during the warm months and have snowball fights during the winter. And there are little student center spaces and rooms throughout campus where students can study, watch tv, do work, or just hang out.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: The facilities were great! I loved my dorm, especially Junior and Senior years, and the school always maintained a professionalism in the way it looked. The academics were great, and there are many programs that the campus offers to study abroad, or to travel overseas/within the US to do community service work.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: There isn't much to do in the town unless it is a campus-sponsored event. It is surrounded by beautiful scenery which provides many opportunities for hiking, skiing, running, and rowing, and the school offers numerous cultural events. But in terms of shopping/big attractions, there isn't much.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review:
school pays for zipcar membership
no need for car
i dont even need a bike
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: typical new england weather. expect very cold winters with lots of snow, beautiful vibrant fall seasons, and perfect springs
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review:
I dont have a car on campus. A bike will suffice for people who live far away, but I get by fine without a bike.
Kids who do have cars park at their greek houses or in a removed parking lot
Town traffic patrollers are strict about ticketing
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review:
Dartmouth has high end technology and prides itself on being very technologically integrated
All classes websites' are integrated on education software systems (Blackboard, Banner, Piazza)
Printing is only an issue once in a while
Campus.Author: College Senior

Campus.Review: The campus is a typical small college town in New England. The library is the focal point of campus, with many great study spaces and an excellent rare books library that has unparalleled access for students. Dorms are mostly great, and frats are......frats. We also have the most land of any college in America, so if you want a cheap outdoors vacation, check out the stunning Grants or the Lodge.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Well, we are known for the frats, but in addition we have a huge variety of organisations, including the amazing Dartmouth Outing Club! If you want to do something, we have it, and it is either the best or the first or the largest or the only in the country.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Hanover is very remote, but it has really been built up alongside the College.  There are a few good off-campus dining options, and the town is beautiful in the fall.  The town is actually pretty active for such a small community, and there is frequent transport to New York City and Boston for students who grow tired of the activities in Hanover.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Students are very friendly, and campus is very social.  Most social events, though, do revolve around the frat and drinking scene on campus.  There are various other activities in which to partake if that isn't your scene, but they might be somewhat pathetic and little-trafficked.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: The facilities are great.  I don't use the gym too much, but the classrooms, dining halls, and other features of the school are well-maintained
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: I don't have a car on campus, but the parking is pretty competitive from what I understand.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Hanover, New Hampshire is definitely an ideal college town, with clothing stores, coffee shops, book stores all located in one concise location. Moreover, everyone is so nice! Even people who you have never met before will go out of their way to open a door for you, or ask you about how you are doing. Definitely a great town, albeit a little pricey.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: There is plenty of transportation services to shuttle you to places you need to go, like the shopping district in West Lebanon. However, information about the transportation (pick-up location, times, etc.) is hard to find.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Great athletic centers, Baker library is awesome, and our campus traditions are unmatched
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Honestly, Hanover is not that exciting. We have a J. Crew... There are plenty of delicious places to eat at, but as far as a bar scene goes... it's not too exciting from what I have heard. In fact, I've heard that if you go to bars often enough, you get to know all of the bartenders...
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: I find all of the seasons at Dartmouth to be a beautiful sight. Fall has that crisp chill and the leaves are falling slowly. Winter is beautiful because everything is like a white blanket and there is that dry cold feeling. Spring is really wet, but a wonderful experience because when everything starts to bloom, everything smells like flowers. Flower petals fall and everything is green and coming to life. I have yet to experience summer, but I heard it is HOT!
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: It's NH, and it gets cold in the winter. Being from the south though, I can say its not TOO bad. Besides, below 5 F its all the same right?
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: The opportunities that are offered at Dartmouth are awesome. As a student, even as a community member, Dartmouth brings many different programs to you. You have the ability to see some big name performers such as Yo Yo Ma and Ke$ha, while still being exposed to more homey experiences such as the farmer's market. With the diversity on campus, you also have the opportunity to experience other cultures such as seeing the lighting of candles for Diwali or Pow-wow in the spring.
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review:
The lots for students are pretty far away, about a 15-20 minute walk from main campus. This isn't bad in the summer/early fall, but in the winter and most of spring it is FREEZING. 

Parking is also available through the greek houses, but is generally very, very expensive.
Campus.Author: Recent Alumnus

Campus.Review: There are computers all throughout campus, that are usually in working order. The only time they will not be functioning is if GreenPrint is undergoing some work. Dartmouth Secure, Public, and Library Public run great. Again, if there is a usually a problem it will be campus wide and resolved promptly. With that said, there is a great need for personal computers, they will be needed for everything.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: The weather varies much like the seasons. Fall is beautiful, can be somewhat chilly but usually fair weather. Winters can be rough, so be prepared. Temperatures tend to change drastically throughout the day. Spring is fairly rainy in the beginning, but the weather improves toward the end. Summer is hot and humid for the most part. Overall, a wide array of weather and temperatures.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: It's definitely a really pretty campus with a lot of amenities. There are incredible libraries with so many resources. All old buildings are entirely renovated or will get renovated soon; the Life Sciences Center is absolutely amazing.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review:
The student center (Collis) has one of the main dining establishments on campus, hosts entertainment (comedians, magicians, student performance groups), has a convenience store, a TV lounge, and study rooms. It's being renovated this winter (2013) and will have even more hangout spaces and a bigger space for dining. 

Our libraries have an endless amount of resources and the librarians are more than eager to help students. There are different library atmospheres for everyone's varying preferences. We have very old, traditional-looking libraries to modern ones, spaces that are social to completely silent, small study rooms to huge rooms with rows of long tables to cubicles.

Our athletic center is beautiful and has every type of machine and equipment. There are tons of fun P.E. classes that take advantage of the beautiful surroundings, like skiing, whitewater kayaking, and horseback riding.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Parking is an interesting question considering barely any students have cars on campus. The best option is to park in on of the frats lots when they message campus about open spots. It is reasonably priced and in the center of campus. But you have to keep in mind that with your car at a frat you run the risk of a drunk freshman running into your car of even throwing up on it. Or you can pay more to park in the student lot which is quite far away from campus. If you don't plan on using your car often and just want to have it available if you need it someday than it isn't a bad option.
Campus.Author: College Sophomore

Campus.Review: really cold and dreary mostly; sunny days=gorgeous
Campus.Author: College Junior

Campus.Review: Dartmouth requires all students to have a laptop coming in freshman year, but they also have some public desktop computers at the library.  The printing system, while it sometimes has a few glitches, makes it easy to print to any location on campus there is a printer; there is no real need to bring a personal printer.  There is campus-wide wi-fi, which sometimes takes a while to connect to but makes internet access anywhere pretty convenient.  The public network is a little slow, but the secure network for students and staff is fast enough for most anything.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review: Public transportation around the Hanover area is much better than expected.  There are several free busses (the Advance Transit) that go between campus and various sites in Hanover and the nearby towns.  Buses are a little slow, but come frequently and make a lot of stops.  For long-distance, there are reasonably-priced coach buses (with free snacks and wi-fi) to Boston and New York City.
Campus.Author: College Freshman

Campus.Review:
